items.title: Poland shoots down drones over its territory amid Russian attack on Ukraine | First Thing
items.standfirst: Prime minister Donald Tusk said operation took place after ‘repeated violations of Polish airspace’. Plus, New Mexico to become the first state to offer free universal childcareGood morning.Polish and Nato air defenses shot down several drones that entered its airspace on Wednesday morning, as Russia’s attack on Ukraine spread to Nato territory in the most significant way since the war began.Is this a first? A stray Ukrainian missile struck a southern Polish village in 2022, killing two people. But there have previously been no reports of Polish or other Nato defence forces destroying drones.Could it be an accident? The Ukrainian president, Volodymyr Zelenskyy, doesn’t think so, owing to the number of drones that entered Polish airspace. In his view: “Moscow is always testing the limits of the possible, and if it does not meet a strong reaction, moves to a new level of escalation.”Stay up to date with our live blog.How significant is this? A Georgia-based immigration attorney based said it was “outrageous” and stressed that it was illegal to detain a valid visa-holder in this way.Are there others? Attorneys working on the case had already claimed that immigrants with a valid working status were swept up alongside the people allegedly working unlawfully, and placed in removal proceedings. That view was backed up by an agency official who spoke on condition of anonymity to discuss sensitive government matters. Continue reading...
items.content: Prime minister Donald Tusk said operation took place after ‘repeated violations of Polish airspace’. Plus, New Mexico to become the first state to offer free universal childcareGood morning.Polish and Nato air defenses shot down several drones that entered its airspace on Wednesday morning, as Russia’s attack on Ukraine spread to Nato territory in the most significant way since the war began.Is this a first? A stray Ukrainian missile struck a southern Polish village in 2022, killing two people. But there have previously been no reports of Polish or other Nato defence forces destroying drones.Could it be an accident? The Ukrainian president, Volodymyr Zelenskyy, doesn’t think so, owing to the number of drones that entered Polish airspace. In his view: “Moscow is always testing the limits of the possible, and if it does not meet a strong reaction, moves to a new level of escalation.”Stay up to date with our live blog.How significant is this? A Georgia-based immigration attorney based said it was “outrageous” and stressed that it was illegal to detain a valid visa-holder in this way.Are there others? Attorneys working on the case had already claimed that immigrants with a valid working status were swept up alongside the people allegedly working unlawfully, and placed in removal proceedings. That view was backed up by an agency official who spoke on condition of anonymity to discuss sensitive government matters. Continue reading...

items.title: Poland shoots down drones over its territory amid Russian attack on Ukraine
items.standfirst: Donald Tusk says operation was launched after ‘repeated violations of Polish airspace’Follow the latest updates livePoland scrambled its own and Nato air defences to shoot down several drones that entered its airspace on Wednesday morning, as Russia’s attack on Ukraine spread to Nato territory in the most significant way since the full-scale invasion more than three years ago.Donald Tusk, Poland’s prime minister, convened an emergency meeting of the council of ministers at 8am local time, and said he was in “constant contact” with Nato’s secretary general, Mark Rutte. Continue reading...

Continue reading...

items.content: What was Russia's intent? That's the pivotal question as Poland and its NATO allies consider their response to drones violating its airspace.

items.title: Poland says it shot down Russian drones that violated its airspace
items.standfirst: Poland said Wednesday that it and its NATO allies had shot down Russian drones that violated Polish airspace in what it called an "act of aggression" as Russia launched aerial attacks on Ukraine.
items.content: Poland said Wednesday that it and its NATO allies had shot down Russian drones that violated Polish airspace in what it called an "act of aggression" as Russia launched aerial attacks on Ukraine.(Image credit: Chancellery of the Prime Minister of Poland)

items.title: Poland downs drones that violated its airspace during Russian strikes on Ukraine
items.standfirst: The Polish military said early Wednesday that it had downed drones that violated its airspace as Russia launched aerial attacks on Ukraine. France 24's Gulliver Cragg reports from Kyiv.
items.content: The Polish military said early Wednesday that it had downed drones that violated its airspace as Russia launched aerial attacks on Ukraine. France 24's Gulliver Cragg reports from Kyiv.

items.title: War in Ukraine: NATO says its air defences helped counter drones in Polish airspace
items.standfirst: NATO air defences helped counter drones that entered Polish airspace overnight and alliance chief Mark Rutte is in contact with Warsaw, a NATO spokeswoman said Wednesday. The downing marks the first time that a NATO country has shot down missiles and drones during Russia's three-and-a-half year war.
items.content: NATO air defences helped counter drones that entered Polish airspace overnight and alliance chief Mark Rutte is in contact with Warsaw, a NATO spokeswoman said Wednesday. The downing marks the first time that a NATO country has shot down missiles and drones during Russia's three-and-a-half year war.

items.title: Poland says its airspace was violated by unidentified "drone-type objects"
items.standfirst: The Polish military said late Tuesday it's responding to unspecified "drone-type objects" that entered its airspace during Russian strikes on Ukraine.
items.content: The Polish military said late Tuesday it's responding to unspecified "drone-type objects" that entered its airspace during Russian strikes on Ukraine.

items.title: Poland shoots down 'huge number' of Russian drones
items.standfirst: Poland’s military said it scrambled its own and NATO allied air defenses to shoot down Russian drones on Wednesday after they crossed from neighboring Ukraine, the first time in the Ukraine war that Warsaw has engaged Russian assets in its airspace.
items.content: Poland’s military said it scrambled its own and NATO allied air defenses to shoot down Russian drones on Wednesday after they crossed from neighboring Ukraine, the first time in the Ukraine war that Warsaw has engaged Russian assets in its airspace.

ai_summary: Poland shot down Russian drones in its airspace, potentially escalating the Ukraine war.
Prime Minister Tusk stated Poland experienced repeated airspace violations overnight.
NATO Secretary General Mark Rutte is in constant contact with Tusk regarding the situation.
European defense stocks rose after the incident, with Thales and BAE Systems increasing.
A regional governor urged residents to follow guidance from authorities during the event.

items.title: Israel strikes Doha in attack it says targeted Hamas officials
items.standfirst: Israel on Tuesday launched an airstrike in Qatar that hit a building used for ceasefire negotiations between Hamas and Israel. Although Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said the attack targeted senior Hamas officials, the UN and leaders around the world, including the US, condemned the attack as a violation of Qatar's national sovereignty.
items.content: Israel on Tuesday launched an airstrike in Qatar that hit a building used for ceasefire negotiations between Hamas and Israel. Although Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said the attack targeted senior Hamas officials, the UN and leaders around the world, including the US, condemned the attack as a violation of Qatar's national sovereignty.

President Trump expressed disapproval of the Israeli attack in Qatar.
Hamas claimed its leaders survived the attack, but confirmed six deaths.
The White House stated the strike does not advance US or Israeli goals.
Qatar condemned the attack as a violation of its national sovereignty.

clusters.title: New French PM takes office as ‘Block Everything’ protests rock country – Europe live
clusters.neutral_headline: Protests Erupt in France as New Prime Minister Takes Office

items.title: New French PM takes office as ‘Block Everything’ protests rock country – Europe live
items.standfirst: Sebastien Lecornu appointment comes amid protests across France including 1,000 demonstrators trying to enter Gare du Nord station in ParisEmmanuel Macron appoints his third prime minister in a yearA teacher taking part in the protests in Paris said he was against the ousted government’s planned budget cuts. “[François]Bayrou was ousted, [now] his policies must be eliminated,” Christophe Lalande told Reuters, calling for more funding for schools and hospitals.At another protest in the city, unionist Amar Lagha told the news agency:This day is a message to all the workers of this country: that there is no resignation, the fight continues, and a message to this government that we won’t back down, and if we have to die, we’ll die standing. Continue reading...
items.content: Sebastien Lecornu appointment comes amid protests across France including 1,000 demonstrators trying to enter Gare du Nord station in ParisEmmanuel Macron appoints his third prime minister in a yearA teacher taking part in the protests in Paris said he was against the ousted government’s planned budget cuts. “[François]Bayrou was ousted, [now] his policies must be eliminated,” Christophe Lalande told Reuters, calling for more funding for schools and hospitals.At another protest in the city, unionist Amar Lagha told the news agency:This day is a message to all the workers of this country: that there is no resignation, the fight continues, and a message to this government that we won’t back down, and if we have to die, we’ll die standing. Continue reading...

items.title: French police arrest nearly 200 as ‘Block Everything’ protests begin
items.standfirst: French police on Wednesday arrested nearly 200 people in early Wednesday as"Block Everything" protests, called by a loose left-wing coalition amid grassroots anger at President Emmanuel Macron's leadership, got underway. France 24's James Andre reports on the latest in Paris.
items.content: French police on Wednesday arrested nearly 200 people in early Wednesday as"Block Everything" protests, called by a loose left-wing coalition amid grassroots anger at President Emmanuel Macron's leadership, got underway. France 24's James Andre reports on the latest in Paris.

items.title: Protesters in France seeking to "block everything" clash with police
items.standfirst: Protests in Paris and across France, venting anger at President Emmanuel Macron's government, see nearly 200 people arrested as fires are set in the capital.
items.content: Protests in Paris and across France, venting anger at President Emmanuel Macron's government, see nearly 200 people arrested as fires are set in the capital.

items.title: Riot police clash with 'Block Everything' protesters in Paris
items.standfirst: Riot police have clashed with protesters in Paris after they took to the streets in response to calls to 'Block Everything' over discontent with the French government.
items.content: Riot police have clashed with protesters in Paris after they took to the streets in response to calls to 'Block Everything' over discontent with the French government.

items.title: Hundreds arrested as ‘Block Everything’ protests grip France
items.standfirst: More than 80,000 police have been deployed as demonstrators rally against Macron's government and austerity policies.
items.content: More than 80,000 police have been deployed as demonstrators rally against Macron's government and austerity policies.

items.title: Lecornu set to become France's third PM in less than a year
items.standfirst: An official handover is set to take place in Paris this afternoon between ousted former prime minister François Bayrou and his replacement Sebastien Lecornu. French President Emmanuel Macron on Tuesday named defence minister and close ally Lecornu as the new prime minister to resolve a deepening political crisis that saw Bayrou's government toppled in a confidence vote. Clovis Casali has the latest.
items.content: An official handover is set to take place in Paris this afternoon between ousted former prime minister François Bayrou and his replacement Sebastien Lecornu. French President Emmanuel Macron on Tuesday named defence minister and close ally Lecornu as the new prime minister to resolve a deepening political crisis that saw Bayrou's government toppled in a confidence vote. Clovis Casali has the latest.

items.title: 'Block Everything' protests sweep France, intensifying pressure on Macron
items.standfirst: Protesters blocked highways and gas stations across France early Wednesday as part of a new nationwide movement.
items.content: Protesters blocked highways and gas stations across France early Wednesday as part of a new nationwide movement.

items.title: New French PM Lecornu takes office amid nationwide disruption
items.standfirst: Sébastien Lecornu, the loyalist picked by President Emmanuel Macron to be France's fifth prime minister in two years, took the reins on a day of sprawling anti-government protests on Wednesday that underlined the depth of the country's political crisis. The protests sparked clashes with police and hundreds of arrests. Follow our live blog for all the day's developments.
items.content: Sébastien Lecornu, the loyalist picked by President Emmanuel Macron to be France's fifth prime minister in two years, took the reins on a day of sprawling anti-government protests on Wednesday that underlined the depth of the country's political crisis. The protests sparked clashes with police and hundreds of arrests. Follow our live blog for all the day's developments.

items.title: Macron appoints Defense Minister Sebastien Lecornu as new Prime Minister
items.standfirst: French President Emmanuel Macron on Tuesday appointed Defense Minister Sebastien Lecornu as his new Prime Minister after François Bayrou tendered his resignation over a vote of no confidence. Lecornu, Macron's third prime minister in the past year, faces the daunting task of passing the national budget through a gridlocked National Assembly.
items.content: French President Emmanuel Macron on Tuesday appointed Defense Minister Sebastien Lecornu as his new Prime Minister after François Bayrou tendered his resignation over a vote of no confidence. Lecornu, Macron's third prime minister in the past year, faces the daunting task of passing the national budget through a gridlocked National Assembly.

items.title: Macron names close ally Lecornu new PM
items.standfirst: French President Emmanuel Macron on Tuesday named armed forces minister and his close ally Sebastien Lecornu as the new prime minister to replace Francois Bayrou as the seventh premier of his mandate. The formal handover of power between Bayrou and Lecornu is due to take place on Wednesday at midday. FRANCE 24's Claire Paccalin reports.
items.content: French President Emmanuel Macron on Tuesday named armed forces minister and his close ally Sebastien Lecornu as the new prime minister to replace Francois Bayrou as the seventh premier of his mandate. The formal handover of power between Bayrou and Lecornu is due to take place on Wednesday at midday. FRANCE 24's Claire Paccalin reports.

items.title: Macron names close ally Sebastien Lecornu as new French PM
items.standfirst: Sebastien Lecornu, 39, is facing an uphill battle over budget as protests loom in the coming days.
items.content: Sebastien Lecornu, 39, is facing an uphill battle over budget as protests loom in the coming days.

items.title: France's new PM tasked with forging consensus on 2026 budget
items.standfirst: French President Emmanuel Macron has picked defence chief Sébastien Lecornu as his new prime minister, a day after François Bayrou was voted out by parliament. The 39-year-old Lecornu's immediate priority will be to try to forge consensus on a new budget, before forming a government. If this year's budget were to be carried over into next year, France's fiscal deficit, already the highest in the EU, is predicted to widen further.
items.content: French President Emmanuel Macron has picked defence chief Sébastien Lecornu as his new prime minister, a day after François Bayrou was voted out by parliament. The 39-year-old Lecornu's immediate priority will be to try to forge consensus on a new budget, before forming a government. If this year's budget were to be carried over into next year, France's fiscal deficit, already the highest in the EU, is predicted to widen further.

items.title: Macron names ally Sébastien Lecornu as new French PM
items.standfirst: It comes after a vote of confidence ousted François Bayrou after nine months in power.
items.content: It comes after a vote of confidence ousted François Bayrou after nine months in power.

items.title: France's ruling government collapses in major blow to President Emmanuel Macron
items.standfirst: France's National Assembly is set to vote for a motion of no confidence in François Bayrou, less than a year after they did the same for Michel Barnier.
items.content: France's National Assembly is set to vote for a motion of no confidence in François Bayrou, less than a year after they did the same for Michel Barnier.

ai_summary: Protests, including "Block Everything" demonstrations, occurred across France.
Nearly 200 people were arrested during the protests.
The new Prime Minister, Sebastien Lecornu, was sworn into office.
Protesters clashed with police in Paris during the demonstrations.
Protests were fueled by anger at President Macron's leadership and budget cuts.

items.content: Protests in Nepal turned deadly after thousands of youngsters marched against the blocking of social media platforms.

items.title: Social media ban sparks violent protests in Nepal
items.standfirst: In Nepal, the government’s ban of social media apps including Facebook and Instagram sparked violent protests. The prime minister has now resigned and the government revoked the ban. NBC News’ Raf Sanchez reports.
items.content: In Nepal, the government’s ban of social media apps including Facebook and Instagram sparked violent protests. The prime minister has now resigned and the government revoked the ban. NBC News’ Raf Sanchez reports.

items.title: Nepal parliament set on fire after PM resigns over anti-corruption protests
items.standfirst: KP Sharma Oli steps down amid Nepal's worst unrest in decades, with at least 22 deaths reported in clashes.
items.content: KP Sharma Oli steps down amid Nepal's worst unrest in decades, with at least 22 deaths reported in clashes.

items.title: Nepal prime minister quits after deaths at protests sparked by social media ban
items.standfirst: KP Sharma Oli resigns as police meet protests with deadly force, leaving 19 dead, and federal parliament is set alight Nepal’s prime minister has resigned after some of the worst unrest in decades rocked the country this week, set off by a ban on social media and discontent at political corruption and nepotism.KP Sharma Oli’s resignation came a day after widespread protests were met with deadly force by police, leaving 19 dead and hundreds injured. The spark for the protests was a government ban on 26 prominent social media apps, but escalated into a larger mass movement against corruption among political elites. Continue reading...
items.content: KP Sharma Oli resigns as police meet protests with deadly force, leaving 19 dead, and federal parliament is set alight Nepal’s prime minister has resigned after some of the worst unrest in decades rocked the country this week, set off by a ban on social media and discontent at political corruption and nepotism.KP Sharma Oli’s resignation came a day after widespread protests were met with deadly force by police, leaving 19 dead and hundreds injured. The spark for the protests was a government ban on 26 prominent social media apps, but escalated into a larger mass movement against corruption among political elites. Continue reading...

items.title: Nepal PM resigns after deadly protests triggered by social media ban
items.standfirst: Nepal's prime minister KP Sharma Oli has resigned after violent anti-corruption protests.
items.content: Nepal's prime minister KP Sharma Oli has resigned after violent anti-corruption protests.

items.title: At least 19 killed in ‘gen Z’ protests against Nepal’s social media ban
items.standfirst: Many demonstrators say they are also on the streets over corruption and nepotism they allege is rampant At least 19 people have been killed during protests in Nepal over a government ban on dozens of online platforms including Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp and X.The government has faced mounting criticism after imposing a ban on 26 prominent social media platforms and messaging apps last week because they had missed a deadline to register under new regulations. Continue reading...

items.standfirst: The U.S. labor market added 911,000 fewer jobs in the past year than earlier reported, the Bureau of Labor Statistics announced on Tuesday. Bush administration and former director of the Congressional Budget Office, joins with analysis.
items.content: The U.S. labor market added 911,000 fewer jobs in the past year than earlier reported, the Bureau of Labor Statistics announced on Tuesday. CBS News MoneyWatch correspondent Kelly O'Grady has the details. Then, Douglas Holtz-Eakin, former chief economic adviser for the George W. Bush administration and former director of the Congressional Budget Office, joins with analysis.

items.title: US created 911,000 fewer jobs through March 2025 than initially reported
items.standfirst: Revision highlights recent concerns about the health of the labor market, and follows a lackluster August jobs reportBusiness live – latest updatesThe US added 911,000 fewer jobs than first estimated for the year to March 2025, the Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) announced on Tuesday, highlighting recent concerns about the health of the labor market.The revisions are 50% higher than last year’s adjustment and were on the higher end of Wall Street estimates between 600,000 and 1 million. Continue reading...
items.content: Revision highlights recent concerns about the health of the labor market, and follows a lackluster August jobs reportBusiness live – latest updatesThe US added 911,000 fewer jobs than first estimated for the year to March 2025, the Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) announced on Tuesday, highlighting recent concerns about the health of the labor market.The revisions are 50% higher than last year’s adjustment and were on the higher end of Wall Street estimates between 600,000 and 1 million. Continue reading...

ai_summary: The US labor market added 911,000 fewer jobs than previously reported.
The revision highlights concerns about the health of the labor market.
The Bureau of Labor Statistics announced the downward revision.
The revision covers the period up to March 2025.
The revision was higher than Wall Street estimates.
